issue.title: PHP 8.1 deprecated warning
issue.body: On line 1307 of object-cache.php the port needs to be cast to a string to prevent a deprecated warning when the port is zero when using php 8.1

commits.message:
[CMSP-676] WP Redis PHP 8.3 compatibility checks (#446)

* add wpunit-helpers

* bump php version for linting to 8.3 and add php execution check

* add php8 compat checker

* add test first pass
still need to enable redis

* bump composer.lock

* add and use redis tests

* update the phpcs:ignore line

* maybe start redis?

* setup and test redis

* test with redis disabled

* check if the database exists before running redis-enabled tests

* fine..

* remove phpunit tests from circle

* add some linebreaks between the phpunit runs

* add -e to echoes

* add emoji for the tests
so they're easier to see and because I'm a dork

* remove scripts sourced from wpunit-helpers from source control

* add a matrix for redis enabled true/false

* use a single script
and export the WP_REDIS_USE_CACHE_GROUPS var for redis tests

* we don't need the redis test now

* we don't need the line breaks anymore

pull_request.title: [CMSP-676] WP Redis PHP 8.3 compatibility checks
pull_request.body:
* moves all PHP Unit tests from Circle to GH Actions
* adds [`pantheon-systems/wpunit-helpers`](https://github.com/pantheon-systems/wpunit-helpers)
* removes `install-wp-tests.sh` from version control (installed via `wpunit-helpers`)
* updates the sniff to ignore on one sniff in `object-cache.php`

comment.body:
I don't think so.

There aren't any required libraries that are consumed by users. So there's nothing that Composer knows about that users on 7.4 would care about. For our 7.4 testing, we `composer update` specifically _because_ some of the dependencies are different between 7.x and 8.x (for the 8.x builds we don't need to `composer update`, we can just `composer install`). I think this must've gotten auto-changed due to some dependency package requiring a higher version of PHP.

pull_request.body:
* moves all PHP Unit tests from Circle to GH Actions

comment.diff_hunk:
@@ -39,3 +39,62 @@ jobs:
         uses: pantheon-systems/action-wporg-validator@1.0.0
         with:
           type: plugin
+  php8-compatibility:
+    name: PHP 8.x Compatibility
+    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
+    steps:
+      - name: Checkout
+        uses: actions/checkout@v3
+      - uses: pantheon-systems/phpcompatibility-action@dev
+        with:
+          paths: ${{ github.workspace }}/*.php
+          test-versions: 8.0-
+  test:
+    needs: lint
+    name: Test
+    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
+    strategy:
+      matrix:
+        php_version: [7.4, 8.2, 8.3]
+        redis_enabled: [true, false]
+    services:
+      mariadb:
+        image: mariadb:${{ (matrix.php_version == '7.4') && '10.5' || '10.6' }}
+      redis:
+        image: redis:6.2
+        ports:
+          - 6379:6379
+    steps:
+      - uses: actions/checkout@v3
+      - name: Setup PHP
+        uses: shivammathur/setup-php@v2
+        with:
+          php-version: ${{ matrix.php_version }}
+          extensions: mysqli, zip, imagick, redis
+      - name: Start MySQL Service
+        run: sudo systemctl start mysql
+      - name: Test Redis
+        run: |
+          sudo apt-get install -y redis-tools
+          redis-cli -h localhost ping
+      - name: Cache dependencies
+        uses: actions/cache@v3
+        with:
+          path: ~/vendor
+          key: test-dependencies-{{ checksum "composer.json" }}
+          restore-keys: test-dependencies-{{ checksum "composer.json" }}
+      - name: Install dependencies
+        run: |
+          if [ ${{ matrix.php_version }} = "7.4" ]; then
+            composer update
+          fi
+          composer install
+      - name: Run PHPUnit
+        run: |
+          if [ ${{ matrix.redis_enabled }} = 'true' ]; then
+            export WP_REDIS_USE_CACHE_GROUPS=1

comment.body: if you made `${{ matrix.redis_enabled }}` 1 and 0, you could just export the env variable and lose the conditional but then you don't have the emoji 😁

comment.body: I'm 100% in favor of generated/dependency code out of version control. I actually thought these would be written to a path under vendor/ so wouldn't have be to ignored separately, but that's likely a conversation for the other project. breaking change 2.0 here we come!

commits.message: we don't need the line breaks anymore
remove scripts sourced from wpunit-helpers from source control
add a matrix for redis enabled true/false

use a single script
and export the WP_REDIS_USE_CACHE_GROUPS var for redis tests
we don't need the redis test now

comment.diff_hunk:
@@ -39,3 +39,58 @@ jobs:
         uses: pantheon-systems/action-wporg-validator@1.0.0
         with:
           type: plugin
+  php8-compatibility:
+    name: PHP 8.x Compatibility
+    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
+    steps:
+      - name: Checkout
+        uses: actions/checkout@v3
+      - uses: pantheon-systems/phpcompatibility-action@dev
+        with:
+          paths: ${{ github.workspace }}/*.php
+          test-versions: 8.0-
+  test:
+    needs: lint
+    name: Test
+    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
+    strategy:
+      matrix:
+        php_version: [7.4, 8.2, 8.3]
+    services:
+      mariadb:
+        image: mariadb:${{ (matrix.php_version == '7.4') && '10.5' || '10.6' }}
+      redis:
+        image: redis:6.2
+        ports:
+          - 6379:6379
+    steps:
+      - uses: actions/checkout@v3
+      - name: Setup PHP
+        uses: shivammathur/setup-php@v2
+        with:
+          php-version: ${{ matrix.php_version }}
+          extensions: mysqli, zip, imagick, redis
+      - name: Start MySQL Service
+        run: sudo systemctl start mysql
+      - name: Test Redis
+        run: |
+          sudo apt-get install -y redis-tools
+          redis-cli -h localhost ping
+      - name: Cache dependencies
+        uses: actions/cache@v3
+        with:
+          path: ~/vendor
+          key: test-dependencies-{{ checksum "composer.json" }}
+          restore-keys: test-dependencies-{{ checksum "composer.json" }}
+      - name: Install dependencies
+        run: |
+          if [ ${{ matrix.php_version }} = "7.4" ]; then
+            composer update
+          fi
+          composer install
+      - name: Run PHPUnit
+        run: |
+          echo -e "\n\n🪫 Testing with Redis disabled"
+          bash ./bin/phpunit-test.sh
+          echo -e "\n\n🔋 Testing with Redis enabled"
+          bash ./bin/phpunit-redis-test.sh
comment.body: actually, if we're going to just re-use `phpunit-test.sh` I think this is necessary, because otherwise the tests will fail because the database exists (that's why there's the database check at the beginning of the `-redis-` one...

pull_request.title: [CMSP-676] WP Redis PHP 8.3 compatibility checks
pull_request.body:
* moves all PHP Unit tests from Circle to GH Actions
* adds [`pantheon-systems/wpunit-helpers`](https://github.com/pantheon-systems/wpunit-helpers)
* added a new `phpunit-test`-style script that tests with Redis groups enabled, specifically (part of porting things over from Circle to GHA)
* updates the sniff to ignore on one sniff in `object-cache.php`

pull_request.title: [CMSP-676] WP Redis PHP 8.3 compatibility checks
pull_request.body:
* moves all PHP Unit tests from Circle to GH Actions
* adds [`pantheon-systems/wpunit-helpers`](https://github.com/pantheon-systems/wpunit-helpers)
* added a new `phpunit-test`-style script that tests with Redis groups enabled, specifically (part of porting things over from Circle to GHA)
* updates the sniff to ignore on one sniff in `object-cache.php`

comment.body: We could, I suppose, leave it as one file and `export WP_REDIS_USE_CACHE_GROUPS=1` in the test workflow, though, yeah?

pull_request.title: [CMSP-676] WP Redis PHP 8.3 compatibility checks
pull_request.body:
* moves all PHP Unit tests from Circle to GH Actions
* adds [`pantheon-systems/wpunit-helpers`](https://github.com/pantheon-systems/wpunit-helpers)
* added a new `phpunit-test`-style script that tests with Redis groups enabled, specifically (part of porting things over from Circle to GHA)
* updates the sniff to ignore on one sniff in `object-cache.php`

pull_request.title: [CMSP-676] WP Redis PHP 8.3 compatibility checks
pull_request.body:
* moves all PHP Unit tests from Circle to GH Actions
* adds [`pantheon-systems/wpunit-helpers`](https://github.com/pantheon-systems/wpunit-helpers)
* added a new `phpunit-test`-style script that tests with Redis groups enabled, specifically (part of porting things over from Circle to GHA)
* updates the sniff to ignore on one sniff in `object-cache.php`

comment.body: I left it two files because `phpunit-test.sh` is sourced from `pantheon-systems/wpunit-helpers`. Since that plugin runs on `composer install`/`composer update`, if we changed that file, it would be overwritten, so Redis tests needed to be split into a separate thing. We _could_ modify the source (in `wpunit-helpers`) but that feels like a lot of work for a single implementation/plugin. (e.g. why would we change the script designed to run on _any_ WP plugin for just _one_ WP plugin?)

* added a new `phpunit-test`-style script that tests with Redis groups enabled, specifically (part of porting things over from Circle to GHA)
* updates the sniff to ignore on one sniff in `object-cache.php`

comment.body: they're installed via `pantheon-systems/wpunit-helpers`. I could, if I wanted to, `.gitignore` them and remove them from version control, that way they'd _always_ be sourced from the composer plugin. I'm generally ambivalent about what happens beyond getting them from that dependency.

comment.body: didn't you move these to a dependency?

pull_request.title: [CMSP-676] WP Redis PHP 8.3 compatibility checks
pull_request.body:
* moves all PHP Unit tests from Circle to GH Actions
* adds [`pantheon-systems/wpunit-helpers`](https://github.com/pantheon-systems/wpunit-helpers)
* added a new `phpunit-test`-style script that tests with Redis groups enabled, specifically (part of porting things over from Circle to GHA)

comment.body:
or if you want two files still, with some adjustment you could do something like this I think
```
#!/bin/bash
...
export WP_REDIS_USE_CACHE_GROUPS=1
bash "${DIRNAME}/phpunit-test.sh"
```
